intro: Gouania glandulosa var. longiloba, commonly known as the long-stalked gouania, is a herbaceous plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves with glandular dots, which contribute to its botanical uniqueness. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, typical of the family. The variety longiloba is distinguished by its elongated peduncles, giving it a distinctive appearance compared to other varieties of Gouania.
